intro: Cyphostemma schimperi, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cyphostemma schimperi thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
